channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump's agenda for Asia trip. And, government shutdown threatens food benefits
item.description: President Trump is expected to meet with China's President Xi Jinping and discuss a trade deal. And, the government shutdown could soon impact food benefits like SNAP as the holiday season approaches.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is expected to meet with China's President Xi Jinping and discuss a trade deal. And, the government shutdown could soon impact food benefits like SNAP as the holiday season approaches.

(Image credit: Issei Kato)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump expected to meet with China's president in South Korea
item.description: President Trump will visit Japan Monday before heading to South Korea, where he's expected to meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping.
item.content:encoded: President Trump will visit Japan Monday before heading to South Korea, where he's expected to meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping.
item.dc:creator: Mara Liasson

item.title: Why public media giants NPR and CPB are fighting in court this week
item.description: NPR is accusing the Corporation for Public Broadcasting in federal court of reneging on a contract to appease the White House.
item.content:encoded:
NPR is accusing the Corporation for Public Broadcasting in federal court of reneging on a contract to appease the White House.

(Image credit: SAUL LOEB/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Out-of-network and on your own? What to do if your insurer drops your doctors
item.description: Patients sometimes find themselves scrambling for affordable care when their insurer and hospital get into a contract dispute. Here are six things to know if that happens to you.
item.content:encoded: Patients sometimes find themselves scrambling for affordable care when their insurer and hospital get into a contract dispute. Here are six things to know if that happens to you.
item.dc:creator: Bram Sable-Smith

item.title: Sheep, soldiers, and grains: Studying the physics of crowds
item.description: In Pamplona, where the bulls run, a scientist studies the physics of crowds.
item.content:encoded:
In Pamplona, where the bulls run, a scientist studies the physics of crowds.

(Image credit: Ari Daniel)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Melissa strengthens to a Category 5 hurricane as it nears Jamaica
item.description: Melissa is forecast to make landfall on the island of Jamaica Tuesday, with up to 30 inches of rain and a life-threatening storm surge. Category 5 is the highest on the Saffir-Simpson scale.
item.content:encoded:
Melissa is forecast to make landfall on the island of Jamaica Tuesday, with up to 30 inches of rain and a life-threatening storm surge. Category 5 is the highest on the Saffir-Simpson scale.

(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: People are having fewer kids. Their choice is transforming the world's economy
item.description: Family size around the world is dropping. That choice by couples is triggering a population shift that's sending shock waves through economies.
item.content:encoded:
Family size around the world is dropping. That choice by couples is triggering a population shift that's sending shock waves through economies.

(Image credit: Lauren Petracca for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: How one teacher's kindness changed a grieving teenager's life
item.description: When Eric Schwartz was 15, his mother died. The first day back at school after the loss was difficult, but one teacher's kindness changed his experience of the day and the rest of his life.
item.content:encoded:
When Eric Schwartz was 15, his mother died. The first day back at school after the loss was difficult, but one teacher's kindness changed his experience of the day and the rest of his life.

(Image credit: Schwartz family photo)
item.dc:creator: Autumn Barnes

item.title: Got 3 minutes? This habit may help boost hope and reduce stress
item.description: Social media can push us to the dark side, with negative content. A new study finds watching inspiring videos for just 3 minutes a day is on par with meditation for boosting mood and reducing stress.
item.content:encoded:
Social media can push us to the dark side, with negative content. A new study finds watching inspiring videos for just 3 minutes a day is on par with meditation for boosting mood and reducing stress.

(Image credit: Oscar Wong)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Milei triumphs in Argentine midterm elections closely watched by Washington
item.description: President Milei won in key districts in an election widely seen as a referendum on his past two years in office. Trump had appeared to condition billions of dollars in backing on a good showing for Milei.
item.content:encoded:
President Milei won in key districts in an election widely seen as a referendum on his past two years in office. Trump had appeared to condition billions of dollars in backing on a good showing for Milei.

(Image credit: Rodrigo Abd)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
